paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses mutations in the KCNH2 gene, specifically S620T, S641A, and S641T, and their effects on hERG channel function and drug interactions.

patients.phenotype: abolished inactivation and significantly attenuated dofetilide block

individual_records.phenotype_details: abolished inactivation and significantly attenuated dofetilide block
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Replacing S620 with threonine (S620T) has been shown to abolish inactivation and significantly attenuate dofetilide block of hERG.

functional_data.summary: The S620T mutation abolishes inactivation and affects drug binding.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation is associated with significant functional changes in the hERG channel.
key_quotes: Replacing S620 with threonine (S620T) has been shown to abolish inactivation and significantly attenuate dofetilide block of hERG.

patients.phenotype: strongly increases hERG channel inactivation and attenuates binding of E-4031

individual_records.phenotype_details: strongly increases hERG channel inactivation and attenuates binding of E-4031
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The S641A mutation has been shown to strongly increase hERG channel inactivation and attenuate the binding of E-4031.

functional_data.summary: The S641A mutation enhances inactivation and alters drug binding.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation significantly affects the functional properties of the hERG channel.
key_quotes: The S641A mutation has been shown to strongly increase hERG channel inactivation and attenuate the binding of E-4031.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The S641T mutation suggested a potential molecular mechanism preventing F627 side chain from shifting into the ion conduction pathway during the proposed inactivation process.

functional_data.summary: The S641T mutation is associated with non-inactivating properties.

variants.additional_notes: The functional impact of this mutation is less clear compared to S620T and S641A.
key_quotes: The S641T mutation suggested a potential molecular mechanism preventing F627 side chain from shifting into the ion conduction pathway during the proposed inactivation process.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in KCNH2 were extracted successfully.
